criteria: Reading Comprehension: Ability to understand explicit meanings and infer implicit meanings within literary texts.
Textual Analysis: Ability to analyze literary devices, techniques, and structural elements within stories, dramas, and poems.
Interpretation and Synthesis: Ability to interpret literary texts and synthesize information from multiple sources to develop a cohesive understanding.
Vocabulary and Language Use: Skill in using context clues to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words and phrases, and effectively using academic language to discuss and analyze literature.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the text; unable to identify key details or make basic inferences.
Struggles to understand the text; identifies few key details and makes inaccurate inferences.
Demonstrates a partial understanding of the text; identifies some key details but struggles with more complex inferences.
Demonstrates a general understanding of the text; identifies most key details and makes logical inferences with some support.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the text; identifies key details and makes well-supported inferences independently.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the text; identifies nuanced details and makes insightful inferences, demonstrating a deep engagement with the material.
Unable to identify any literary devices or structural elements in the text.
Identifies literary devices or structural elements inaccurately or with significant prompting.
Identifies some basic literary devices or structural elements but struggles to explain their purpose or effect.
Identifies and explains the purpose or effect of several literary devices or structural elements with some guidance.
Independently identifies and analyzes the purpose and effect of various literary devices and structural elements.
Provides a sophisticated and insightful analysis of literary devices and structural elements, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of their impact on the text as a whole.
Unable to interpret the text or synthesize information from other sources.
Struggles to interpret the text or synthesize information, providing inaccurate or incomplete interpretations.
Offers a basic interpretation of the text but struggles to synthesize information from multiple sources.
Provides a reasonable interpretation of the text and synthesizes information from some sources with moderate success.
Develops a well-supported interpretation of the text and effectively synthesizes information from multiple sources to enhance understanding.
Constructs a complex and insightful interpretation of the text, skillfully synthesizing information from various sources to create a comprehensive and nuanced understanding.
Unable to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words or use academic language.
Struggles to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words or use academic language effectively.
Uses context clues to determine the meaning of some unfamiliar words and uses academic language inconsistently.
Uses context clues to determine the meaning of most unfamiliar words and uses academic language appropriately in discussions and analyses.
Consistently uses context clues to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words and effectively uses academic language to discuss and analyze literature.
Demonstrates a mastery of vocabulary and academic language, using them skillfully to enhance comprehension and analysis of literary texts.
